intro: Acidocroton steyermarkii, commonly known as the Steyermark's acidocroton, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
